秋分.definition: Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October

秋審.definition: autumn trial (judicial hearing of capital cases during Ming and Qing)

秋後算帳.definition: lit. settle accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts; to bide one's time for revenge

秋後算賬.definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn (idiom); fig. to settle scores at an opportune time

秋播.definition: sowing in autumn (for a crop in spring)

秋收起義.definition: Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong

秋榜.definition: results of the autumn imperial examinations

秋毫.definition: fine hair grown by animals (or down grown by birds) in the fall; (fig.) sth barely discernible; the slightest thing; the minutest detail

秋毫無犯.definition: (idiom) (of soldiers) highly disciplined, not committing the slightest offense against civilians

秋水.definition: limpid autumn waters (trad. description of girl's beautiful eyes)

秋波.definition: autumn ripples; (fig.) luminous eyes of a woman; amorous glance

秋獮.definition: (of an emperor) to hunt in autumn

秋瑾.definition: Qiu Jin (1875-1907), famous female martyr of the anti-Qing revolution, the subject of several books and films

秋老虎.definition: hot spell during autumn; Indian summer

秋荼密網.definition: flowering autumn grass, fine net (idiom); fig. abundant and exacting punishments prescribed by law

秋菊傲霜.definition: the autumn chrysanthemum braves the frost (idiom)

秋葉原.definition: Akihabara, region of downtown Tokyo famous for electronics stores

秋試.definition: autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)

秋闈.definition: autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)

秋霜.definition: autumn frost; fig. white hair as sign of old age

秋風掃落葉.definition: lit. as the autumn gale sweeps away the fallen leaves (idiom); to drive out the old and make a clean sweep

秋風過耳.definition: lit. as the autumn breeze passes the ear (idiom); not in the least concerned
